entries.title: Congress Proposes More Than $44 Billion for Ukraine
entries.description: The spending bill unveiled Tuesday includes billions more for the country than President Biden had requested.

entries.title: Taliban Release 2 Americans Detained in Afghanistan
entries.description: One of the Americans being held is an independent filmmaker who had been held since August.

entries.title: 33 Pakistani Taliban Militants Killed After Holding Prison Hostage
entries.description: The attack at a detention center in northwestern Pakistan is the latest in a resurgence in violence from Pakistani Taliban militants in recent months.

entries.title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Zelensky Visits Bakhmut
entries.description: Also, Japan’s central bank eases its policy and Fiji prepares for a leadership change.

entries.title: Congress Offers $1 Billion for Climate Aid, Falling Short of Biden’s Pledge
entries.description: Activists called the funding to help developing countries cope with the impacts of climate change “hugely disappointing.”

entries.title: Lauding Their Soldiers, Putin and Zelensky Signal Long Fight Ahead
entries.description: As the 10-month mark of the war nears, the leaders of Ukraine and Russia handed out medals and pledged not to back down.

entries.title: Taliban Bar Women From College Classes, in a Stark Reversal of Rights
entries.description: The new Afghan government has rolled back to its hard-line stances from the 90s, instituting public beatings and executions as well.

entries.title: Congress’s Spending Bill Includes Nearly $50 Billion in Ukraine Aid
entries.description: The new aid would push U.S. investment in the war against Russia to more than $100 billion, and sets aside funds for inspector generals to scrutinize how the money is being spent.

entries.title: At a Holiday Celebration in Southern Ukraine, ‘Kids Still Need Miracles.’
entries.description: Some asked Saint Nicholas for iPhones. Some asked for peace.

entries.title: World Cup Homecoming Brings Argentina to a Halt
entries.description: Crowds thronged the streets of Buenos Aires as Argentina’s men’s national team took a 50-mile victory lap to celebrate its third World Cup title.

entries.title: Kyiv Has Power for a Fifth of Residents After Repeated Russian Attacks
entries.description: “Ten hours without electricity in Kyiv is, unfortunately, a new reality,” the head of the local utility said.

entries.title: UK Strikes: Nurses, Emergency Responders and Rail Workers Walk Out
entries.description: Continuing strikes over pay and economic conditions are likely to disrupt travel and services during the holiday season. Here’s what to expect.

entries.title: In Fiji’s Election, One Former Coup Leader Displaces Another
entries.description: The return of Sitiveni Rabuka paves the way for a potential pivot in a country where the United States and China are fighting for influence.

entries.title: Boat With at Least 160 Rohingya Refugees Is Stranded at Sea
entries.description: The U.N. called on countries in South Asia to rescue those on the vessel, who have been without food for weeks after leaving Bangladesh.

entries.title: E.P.A. Tightens Rules on Pollution From Vans, Buses and Trucks
entries.description: For the first time in decades, the agency has restricted nitrogen dioxide emissions from heavy vehicles.

entries.title: 1922: Last War Prisoners Gone
entries.description: France released its last five German prisoners four years after World War I came to an end.

entries.title: U.S. Commandos Capture Six ISIS Officials in Raids in Syria
entries.description: The operations were the second time in recent weeks that U.S. forces had killed or captured ISIS terrorists.

entries.title: Zelensky Visits Bakhmut, Aiming To Show Ukraine’s Resolve
entries.description: Despite months of Russian bombardments and waves of assaults, the city has remained in Ukrainian control.

entries.title: As Putin Admits Difficulties in Occupied Ukrainian Areas, Zelensky Visits One of Them
entries.description: On a day when the Russian president called on his security agencies to intensify their efforts in eastern and southern Ukraine, the Ukrainian leader visited Bakhmut, which Moscow has failed to capture.

entries.title: Trump’s Culpability
entries.description: The House Jan. 6 committee placed clear blame on Donald Trump.

entries.title: Zelensky visits the battleground city of Bakhmut, aiming to show Ukraine’s resolve.
entries.description: Despite months of Russian bombardments and waves of assaults, the city has remained in Ukrainian control.

entries.title: German Court Sentences Ex-Concentration Camp Secretary to Probation
entries.description: Irmgard Furchner, who was in her late teens when she worked in the Stutthof camp, was convicted as the authorities make a final effort to seek justice for Nazi-era crimes.

entries.title: China’s Abrupt Covid Pivot Leaves Many Without Medicines
entries.description: Millions are desperate to get their hands on fever-reducing drugs and antivirals such as Pfizer’s Paxlovid as infections across China outpace supplies.

entries.title: As Tunisia Drifts Farther From Democracy, Voters Shun Election
entries.description: Turnout in Saturday’s parliamentary elections was just over 11 percent, reflecting deep skepticism that politics can solve the North African nation’s grave governmental and economic crises.

entries.title: One Day With an Ambulance in Britain: Long Waits, Rising Frustration
entries.description: Britain is experiencing a crisis in ambulance response times, part of a broader breakdown in the country’s revered National Health Service. We rode with one crew to witness the problems in real time.

entries.title: Your Tuesday Briefing
entries.description: The House Jan. 6 committee placed clear blame on Donald Trump.

entries.title: Ukraine Urges Russian Soldiers to Surrender to Drones
entries.description: Capitalizing on reports of low Russian morale, Ukraine has begun offering enemy troops detailed instructions on how to make their way over the battlefield and lay down their arms.

entries.title: King Charles III Is the New Face of U.K. Money
entries.description: Pound notes with the new sovereign’s image will begin appearing in 2024, though money with his mother’s likeness will still be in circulation.
